results.title: The Mysterious bee (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Phil Simon, Australian Film Commission and Phil Simon Nature Films
results.brief_description: Through the use of macro photography and slow motion filming, Phil Simon takes the viewer into the world of the honey bee. We see, first hand, the life cycle of the drone, the worker and the queen bee and their roles and interaction with each other in the colony. A highlight of the video is the fight to the death of two queen bees. Advice is also given on how to keep and handle bees.

results.title: The Mysteries of blood: haemostasis and blood coagulation
results.creator_credit: Masami Sugiyama, Eiji Murayama and Sakura Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: It is needless to point out the important role played by the blood for the maintenance of human life and health. In particular, the real fact about blood coagulation is one of the principal problems attracting the attention of modern medical science. This film is intended to show the complicated and clever functions concealed in the simple fact of blood coagulation. Several hitherto unsolved problems have been clarified and new spheres have been presented for future study by this film.

results.title: The Mutton birds of Bass Strait
results.brief_description: A study of the species of mutton bird which appear in large numbers in the Furneaux Islands off North east Tasmania, and which are the basis of a successful commercial undertaking on the Islands. The film depicts preparations for the breeding season, harvesting, cleaning, packing and distribution. Investigations into the biology the the mutton bird commenced in 1947 to determine whether intensive harvesting was depleting the rookeries.

results.title: The Musical ride
results.brief_description: A 1955 film presentation of the famous Musical Ride of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. In a display of brilliant horsemanship, scarlet-coated Mounties take their horses through the many intricate patterns of the Ride, performed to the accompaniment of band music.

results.title: The Music theatre = children's music theatre
results.creator_credit: Terry Byan and Television One (New Zealand)
results.brief_description: Four children’s musical favourites make up this colourful series which features the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra and some of New Zealand’s leading actors and dancers. “Tubby the tuba” tells the story of a tuba who is the ugly duckling of the orchestra. “The Sorcerer’s apprentice” Bored with the daily chores, an apprentice sorcerer seizes the opportunity to apply sorcery to his housework and ends up in trouble. “Peter and the wolf” Prokofiev’s musical introduction to the orchestra tells of Peter and his first encounter with a wolf. “Carnival of the animals” Imaginatively costumed animal characters saunter and cavort in a visually exciting production of the well loved music of Saint-Saens.

results.title: The Music of Giuseppe Verdi
results.creator_credit: United Films and United States. Office of War Information
results.brief_description: This film shows Toscanini conducting pieces by Verdi and also focuses on his and other Italians efforts to fight fascism in Europe by living and working as exiles in America. Music includes La Forza del Oestino and Hymn of the Nations, the second piece being the one Toscanini chose to play on the day Italy was liberated from the fascists. Features Arturo Toscanini as conductor, the NBC Symphony Orchestra, Jan Peerce (tenor) and the Westminster Choir.

results.title: The Music album: songs of the south
results.brief_description: This film is a compilation of songs originating from the southern states of America featuring “Showboat melodies” performed by The Marshalls including ‘I come from Alabama’, ‘Way down upon the Swanee River’ and ‘Campdown races’ and The Dixiairs performing ‘Waiting for the Robert E. Lee’ and ‘Dear old Southland’.
